vocabularies.label: Requirements Management vocabulary
vocabularies.description: Requirements Management vocabulary as of CS01 (24 August 2018)

classes.name: Requirement
classes.label: Requirement
classes.comment: Statement of need.

classes.name: RequirementCollection
classes.label: RequirementCollection
classes.comment: Collection of requirements. A collection uses zero or more requirements.

properties.name: affectedBy
properties.label: affectedBy
properties.comment: Expresses an affects relationship between entities, where the object entity in some way affects the subject entity. For example, a requirement is affected by a defect.

properties.name: constrainedBy
properties.label: constrainedBy
properties.comment: Expresses a constraining relationship between entities, where the object entity constrains the subject entity. For example, a functional requirement is constrained by a safety requirement.

properties.name: constrains
properties.label: constrains
properties.comment: Expresses a constraining relationship between entities, where the subject entity constrains the object entity. For example, a safety requirement constrains a functional requirement.

properties.name: decomposedBy
properties.label: decomposedBy
properties.comment: Expresses a decomposition relationship between entities, where the object entity decomposes the subject entity. For example, a system requirement is decomposed into a collection of system requirements.

properties.name: decomposes
properties.label: decomposes
properties.comment: Expresses a decomposition relationship between entities, where the subject entity decomposes the object entity. For example, a collection of system requirements decompose a system requirement.

properties.name: elaboratedBy
properties.label: elaboratedBy
properties.comment: Expresses an elaboration relationship between entities, where the object entity elaborates the subject entity. For example, a requirement is elaborated by a model element.

properties.name: elaborates
properties.label: elaborates
properties.comment: Expresses an elaboration relationship between entities, where the subject entity elaborates the object entity. For example, a model element elaborates a requirement.

properties.name: implementedBy
properties.label: implementedBy
properties.comment: Expresses an implementation relationship between entities, where the object entity is a necessary or desirable aspect of an implementation of the subject entity.

properties.name: satisfiedBy
properties.label: satisfiedBy
properties.comment: The subject is satisfied by the object. For example, a user requirement is satisfied by a system requirement.

properties.name: satisfies
properties.label: satisfies
properties.comment: Expresses a relationship between entities, where the subject entity satisfies the object entity. For example, a system requirement satisfies a user requirement.

properties.name: specifiedBy
properties.label: specifiedBy
properties.comment: Expresses a specification relationship between entities, where the object entity further clarifies or specifies the subject entity. For example, a requirement is specified by a model element.

properties.name: specifies
properties.label: specifies
properties.comment: Expresses a specification relationship between entities, where the subject entity further clarifies or specifies the object entity. For example, a model element specifies a requirement.

properties.name: trackedBy
properties.label: trackedBy
properties.comment: Expresses a tracking relationship between entities, where the object entity in some way tracks or governs the evolution of the subject entity. For example, a requirement may be said to be tracked by a change request, in that it governs the changes to a requirement according to some process machinery.

properties.name: uses
properties.label: uses
properties.comment: Expresses a use relationship between entities, where the object entity is used by the subject entity. For example, a requirement collection may use a requirement.

properties.name: validatedBy
properties.label: validatedBy
properties.comment: Expresses a validation relationship between entities, where the object entity in some way validates the subject entity. For example, a requirement collection may be said to be validated by a test plan.

classes.name: ChangeNotice
classes.label: ChangeNotice
classes.comment: Represents an assignment notification of a change request. May be used also to bestow authority onto the assigned user to effect the changes.

classes.name: ChangeRequest
classes.label: ChangeRequest
classes.comment: The CM Change Request resource.

classes.name: Defect
classes.label: Defect
classes.comment: A software or product defect.

classes.name: Enhancement
classes.label: Enhancement
classes.comment: A request for new functionality.

classes.name: Priority
classes.label: Priority
classes.comment: Defines the possible oslc_cm:priority property values.

classes.name: ReviewTask
classes.label: ReviewTask
classes.comment: A request to make a change and review the change.

classes.name: Severity
classes.label: Severity
classes.comment: Defines the possible oslc_cm:severity property values.

classes.name: State
classes.label: State
classes.comment: Defines the possible oslc_cm:state property values.

classes.name: Task
classes.label: Task
classes.comment: An executable and trackable activity.

properties.name: affectedByDefect
properties.label: affectedByDefect
properties.comment: Change request is affected by a reported defect. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:Defect.

properties.name: affectsPlanItem
properties.label: affectsPlanItem
properties.comment: Change request affects a plan item. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest.

properties.name: affectsRequirement
properties.label: affectsRequirement
properties.comment: The ChangeRequest affects a Requirement. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement.

properties.name: affectsTestResult
properties.label: affectsTestResult
properties.comment: Associated resource that is affected by this Change Request. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestResult.

properties.name: authorizer
properties.label: authorizer
properties.comment: The URI of a resource describing an agent who is responsible authorizing for and/or has authorized effort to be expended to address a set of change requests.

properties.name: blocksTestExecutionRecord
properties.label: blocksTestExecutionRecord
properties.comment: Associated resource that is blocked by this Change Request. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestExecutionRecord.

properties.name: closeDate
properties.label: closeDate
properties.comment: The date at which no further activity or work is intended to be conducted.

properties.name: implementsRequirement
properties.label: implementsRequirement
properties.comment: The ChangeRequest implements the associated Requirement. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement.

properties.name: parent
properties.label: parent
properties.comment: The related parent change requests of the subject change request.

properties.name: priority
properties.label: priority
properties.comment: Used to indicate the relative importance of ChangeRequests. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:Priority.

properties.name: relatedChangeRequest
properties.label: relatedChangeRequest
properties.comment: This relationship is loosely coupled, has no specific meaning, and can be used to link related change requests. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest.

properties.name: relatedTestCase
properties.label: relatedTestCase
properties.comment: Related test case resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestCase.

properties.name: relatedTestExecutionRecord
properties.label: relatedTestExecutionRecord
properties.comment: Related to a test execution resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestExecutionRecord.

properties.name: relatedTestPlan
properties.label: relatedTestPlan
properties.comment: Related test plan resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestPlan.

properties.name: relatedTestScript
properties.label: relatedTestScript
properties.comment: Related test script resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestScript.

properties.name: severity
properties.label: severity
properties.comment: Used to indicate the severity or potential impact of a defect. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:Severity.

properties.name: state
properties.label: state
properties.comment: Used to indicate the status of the change request.

properties.name: testedByTestCase
properties.label: testedByTestCase
properties.comment: Test case by which this change request is tested. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestCase.

properties.name: tracksChangeSet
properties.label: tracksChangeSet
properties.comment: Tracks a change set resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_config:ChangeSet.

properties.name: tracksRequirement
properties.label: tracksRequirement
properties.comment: Tracks the associated Requirement or Requirement ChangeSet resources. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement.

properties.name: approved
properties.label: approved
properties.comment: Whether or not the Change Request has been approved.

properties.name: closed
properties.label: closed
properties.comment: Whether or not the Change Request is completely done, no further fixes or fix verification is needed.

properties.name: fixed
properties.label: fixed
properties.comment: Whether or not the Change Request has been fixed.

properties.name: inProgress
properties.label: inProgress
properties.comment: Whether or not the Change Request in a state indicating that active work is occurring.

properties.name: reviewed
properties.label: reviewed
properties.comment: Whether or not the Change Request has been reviewed.

properties.name: verified
properties.label: verified
properties.comment: Whether or not the resolution or fix of the Change Request has been verified.

classes.name: Agent
classes.label: Agent
classes.comment: The Agent class is the class of agents; things that do stuff. A well known sub-class is Person, representing people. Other kinds of agents include Organization and Group. The Agent class is useful in a few places in FOAF where Person would have been overly specific. For example, the IM chat ID properties such as jabberID are typically associated with people, but sometimes belong to software bots.

classes.name: Person
classes.label: Person
classes.comment: The Person class represents people. Something is a Person if it is a person. We don't nitpic about whether they're alive, dead, real, or imaginary. The Person class is a sub-class of the Agent class, since all people are considered 'agents' in FOAF.

properties.name: name
properties.label: name
properties.comment: The name of something is a simple textual string.

properties.name: familyName
properties.label: familyName
properties.comment: The familyName property is provided (alongside givenName) for use when describing parts of people's names. Although these concepts do not capture the full range of personal naming styles found world-wide, they are commonly used and have some value.

properties.name: givenName
properties.label: givenName
properties.comment: The givenName property is provided (alongside familyName) for use when describing parts of people's names. Although these concepts do not capture the full range of personal naming styles found world-wide, they are commonly used and have some value.

classes.name: TestCase
classes.label: TestCase
classes.comment: The QM Test Case resource.

classes.name: TestExecutionRecord
classes.label: TestExecutionRecord
classes.comment: The QM Test Execution Record resource.

classes.name: TestPlan
classes.label: TestPlan
classes.comment: The QM Test Plan resource.

classes.name: TestResult
classes.label: TestResult
classes.comment: The QM Test Result resource.

classes.name: TestScript
classes.label: TestScript
classes.comment: The QM Test Script resource.

properties.name: affectedByChangeRequest
properties.label: affectedByChangeRequest
properties.comment: Change request that affects the Test Result. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: blockedByChangeRequest
properties.label: blockedByChangeRequest
properties.comment: Change Request that prevents execution of the Test Execution Record. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: executesTestScript
properties.label: executesTestScript
properties.comment: Test Script executed to produce the Test Result. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestScript but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: executionInstructions
properties.label: executionInstructions
properties.comment: Instructions for executing the test script. Note that the value of Occurs is undefined. The resource shape document provided by the QM service provider may be consulted for its value.

properties.name: producedByTestExecutionRecord
properties.label: producedByTestExecutionRecord
properties.comment: Test Execution Record that the Test Result was produced by. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestExecutionRecord but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: relatedChangeRequest
properties.label: relatedChangeRequest
properties.comment: A related change request. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: reportsOnTestCase
properties.label: reportsOnTestCase
properties.comment: Test Case that the Test Result reports on. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestCase but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: reportsOnTestPlan
properties.label: reportsOnTestPlan
properties.comment: Test Plan that a test or execution record reports on. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestPlan but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: runsOnTestEnvironment
properties.label: runsOnTestEnvironment
properties.comment: Indicates the environment details of the test case for this execution record.

properties.name: runsTestCase
properties.label: runsTestCase
properties.comment: Test Case run by the Test Execution Record. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestCase but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: testsChangeRequest
properties.label: testsChangeRequest
properties.comment: Change Request tested by the Test Case. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: usesTestCase
properties.label: usesTestCase
properties.comment: Test Case used by the Test Plan. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestCase but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: usesTestScript
properties.label: usesTestScript
properties.comment: Test Script used by the Test Case. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_qm:TestScript but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: validatesRequirement
properties.label: validatesRequirement
properties.comment: Requirement that is validated by the Test Case. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: validatesRequirementCollection
properties.label: validatesRequirementCollection
properties.comment: Requirement Collection that is validated by the Test Plan. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:RequirementCollection but that is not necessarily the case.

properties.name: status
properties.label: status
properties.comment: Used to indicate the state of the Test Result based on values defined by the service provider.

classes.name: Class
classes.label: Class
classes.comment: The class resource, everything.

properties.name: label
properties.label: label
properties.comment: A human-readable name for the subject.

properties.name: seeAlso
properties.label: seeAlso
properties.comment: Further information about the subject resource.

properties.name: comment
properties.label: comment
properties.comment: A description of the subject resource.

properties.name: member
properties.label: member
properties.comment: A member of the subject resource.

properties.name: subClassOf
properties.label: subClassOf
properties.comment: The subject is a subclass of a class.

properties.name: type
properties.label: type
properties.comment: The subject is an instance of a class.

properties.name: value
properties.label: value
properties.comment: Idiomatic property used for structured values.

properties.name: contributor
properties.label: contributor
properties.comment: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

properties.name: creator
properties.label: creator
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to identify the creator with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the creator may be provided.

properties.name: created
properties.label: created
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.

properties.name: description
properties.label: description
properties.comment: Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

properties.name: identifier
properties.label: identifier
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to an identification system. Examples include International Standard Book Number (ISBN), Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and Uniform Resource Name (URN). Persistent identifiers should be provided as HTTP URIs.

properties.name: modified
properties.label: modified
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.

properties.name: relation
properties.label: relation
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a string conforming to a formal identification system may be provided.

properties.name: subject
properties.label: subject
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to refer to the subject with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the subject may be provided. Both should preferably refer to a subject in a controlled vocabulary.

properties.name: title
properties.label: title
properties.comment: A name given to the resource.

properties.name: isVersionOf
properties.label: isVersionOf
properties.comment: Changes in version imply substantive changes in content rather than differences in format. This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. This property is an inverse property of Has Version.

properties.name: hasPart
properties.label: Has Part
properties.comment: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. This property is an inverse property of Is Part Of.

properties.name: source
properties.label: source
properties.comment: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

properties.name: type
properties.label: type
properties.comment: Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

properties.name: isPartOf
properties.label: Is Part Of
properties.comment: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. This property is an inverse property of Has Part.

properties.name: date
properties.label: date
properties.comment: Date may be used to express temporal information at any level of granularity. Recommended practice is to express the date, date/time, or period of time according to ISO 8601-1 [ISO 8601-1] or a published profile of the ISO standard, such as the W3C Note on Date and Time Formats [W3CDTF] or the Extended Date/Time Format Specification [EDTF]. If the full date is unknown, month and year (YYYY-MM) or just year (YYYY) may be used. Date ranges may be specified using ISO 8601 period of time specification in which start and end dates are separated by a '/' (slash) character. Either the start or end date may be missing.

properties.name: wasRevisionOf
properties.label: wasRevisionOf
properties.comment: A resource from which this version was derived. This is likely to reference an earlier version of the same concept resource; use of prov:wasDerivedFrom is recommended to indicate an earlier version of a different concept resource. The subject of each instance of this property must be the concept resource URI; the object is likely to be a version resource URI.

properties.name: wasDerivedFrom
properties.label: wasDerivedFrom
properties.comment: A resource from which this version was derived. This is likely to reference a different concept resource; use of prov:wasRevisionOf is recommended to indicate an earlier version of the same concept resource. The subject of each instance of this property must be the concept resource URI; the object can be a version resource URI, or a concept resource URI (possibly for a non-versioned resource).

properties.name: modifiedBy
properties.label: modifiedBy
properties.comment: The URI of a resource describing the entity that most recently modified this resource. The link target is usually a foaf:Person or foaf:Agent, but could be any type. This is modeled after dcterms:creator, but Dublin Core currently has no equivalent property.

classes.name: LinkType
classes.label: LinkType
classes.comment: A locally managed resource that describes a link type predicate that might otherwise not be directly resolvable.

classes.name: Resource
classes.label: ArchitectureResource
classes.comment: A generic architecture resource. A resource of this type is likely to be a model or design artifact.
